name: Hybrid Energy Audit Process
description: A process enabling gradual replacement of manual tasks with automation. It accounts for buildings with IoT capabilities and those without, and allows for concurrent execution of certain tasks.

steps.name: Collect Energy Data
steps.description: Automatically collect building data and historical energy usage from IoT devices and smart meters, if available.

steps.name: Get all Documentation
steps.description: Collect building documentation, energy bills, and other relevant data manually if IoT data is not available or as a backup.

steps.name: Drone Inspection
steps.description: Use drones equipped with cameras and sensors to inspect the building exterior for thermal anomalies and structural issues.

steps.name: Manual Inspection
steps.description: Conduct a manual inspection of the building's energy systems and physical structure.
steps.condition: If drone not available or additional verification required

steps.name: Automated Sensor Measurements
steps.description: Collect measurement data (e.g., temperature, humidity, energy consumption) automatically from installed IoT sensors.

steps.name: Check Measurements
steps.description: Perform manual measurements using portable devices where IoT sensor data is unavailable or for verification purposes.

steps.name: Data Analysis
steps.description: Analyze the combined data from IoT/manual collection, inspections, and measurements using AI tools or manual methods to generate an analysis report.

steps.name: Risk and Investment Assessment
steps.description: Evaluate potential risks, opportunities, and financial feasibility of recommended energy-saving measures based on the analysis report.

steps.name: Reporting and Recommendations
steps.description: Compile the analysis, risk, and investment assessments into a final report and generate recommendations for energy savings, with options for automated generation and manual review.

steps.name: Setup Performance Monitoring
steps.description: Establish a system for continuous performance monitoring of energy usage and the effectiveness of implemented measures.
